text: Has the situation changed since 2018? We’re building a HubSpot CMS site and would like to set CSP meta tag for the site but for that we’d need a list of all domains from which HubSpot loads scripts and stuff.
@all please how i can dnd section on full width in HubSpot boilerplate
Has anybody got experience integrating CMS with woocommerce?
question to you all. How do you go ahead and choose a good developer. We are in the process of hiring a developer for HubSpot CMS. How can we find the right person? Any tips?

• Look at what they’ve built, how fast they built it, and how well they’ve built it on the hs cms.
• assess track record of adaptability – are they still working with ancient techniques or are they keeping up with best practices?
• Check your DM for a good recuiter as well
<#CBNDYJJAZ|jobs> is a good place to post a job listing as well

to me something that helps me gauge them is to ask them about what if any resources they frequent to keep up with the industry.

Example if they tell you some developer podcasts, they tell you the follow well known dev blogs, etc. those are all good signs.

You can also give them a web development test. (did this in the last few hiring situations I had).

Don’t make em do some dumb fizz buzz.

create an isolated example of something  they might have to do in the real job.

Give them mockups/wireframes if needed. Keep it ultra simple, you shouldn’t be asking them to build a full website. You need to respect their time.

But intentionally add in to your mockup things that can help you gauge:
Attention to detail
Whether they are up-to-date on technology or atleast a quick learner

Give them a reasonable time frame, realize they may be working a job right now and have family commitments.

You can learn a lot from a small exercise like this if well thought out and condensed.

Hey folks wondering if anybody has guidance on this... So we're building out a new site in a portal with an existing domain attached and using that existing domain's staging area. Part of launch will actually be attaching a new domain (they got acquired) though... So the staging area for that new domain won't exist until then... So my thought is push everything from staging to the current domain. And then set the primary domain to the new one once it's attached. _*My question is will that auto rollover over all pages to the new primary domain. Or will we have to go page by page and flip the domain (which will be rough because it's like 150 pages...)*_
There is not a way to bulk change domains from within the UI. You may be able to use the Page Publishing API to make the change.
